info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 1:36PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Below Acme affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This surpasses the flood of record. * WHERE...Pecos River below Acme. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM MDT Sunday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.8 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Pecos River Acme 13.0 17.2 Sun 12 pm MD 7.5 6.7 5.8 &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued late tonight around 100 AM MDT.
